lexUnit.name: stand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be in or rise to an upright position, supported by one's feet.

sentence.text: Carrie stood knee deep in the dry , sweet-smelling hay and helped Albert take Frederick 's huge forkfuls that were so heavy , sometimes , it made them both stagger .
Outside stood a man , middle-aged , with thinning dark hair and a black moustache , wearing jeans and a lightweight jacket in pale blue plastic .
Behind Rayne stood his two servants , Ant and Monkey , as thin as their master was fat ; their job was to deliver the food to those who bid successfully for it .
He checked the door of the church was locked and stood engrossed in his own thoughts about Cranston .
Then the door was flung open and Boz stood in the doorway , wild-eyed and angry .
The few detectives who were not out making enquiries sat or stood around the office , some on the telephone , some making notes , others simply chatting .
The king himself stood athwart the arch and observed her from behind his mask .
The stadium was packed beyond capacity ; in every nook and cranny people crammed together , standing four deep on the walkways and filling the steps between the seats .
Lexandro stripped off his mustardy cadet 's tunic , and boots , and loincloth quickly and stood naked .
Her young brother David was standing close by .
For what seemed an age he stood stock-still , his silvery-green eyes on her face , then he reached up and , feeling in the cavity , retrieved its contents .
Yanto was a bit unsure how to take him as he stood there swaying and Billy 's befuddled mind was getting angrier by the second .
I kept looking up at the Royal Box and thinking , ` Stevie Foster would have stood there . " "
Sapt and Fritz stood there looking at me .
In the rectory garden the twins still laughed and clapped , more amused than ever because he was still standing there with his eyes closed , smiling at them .
As they mounted the motorcycle , Yanto stood upright on the footrests and looked over the hedge across the road towards the big house .
He looked as tired as a man could be and still stand upright .
She almost wept with relief as his strong fingers closed round her hand and guided her to the safety of a broad platform of stone , where at last it was possible to stand upright .
I stood fearfully against a board as in rapid succession the knives flashed through the air and encircled my body .
All this bristling weaponry was aimed at a line of about forty men standing against the wall .
At the shop door they all stood around her , and she looked at them solemnly now and said , ` Thank you so much .
He was watching Stella who stood at the fireplace , leaning against the armchair in which Potter now sat holding court .
Terry was standing at the landing window , Rose just retreating down the stairs .
I could have stood at the window all afternoon ,
Ten minutes later , they were standing at the window of the cutler 's shop .
Sufficiently stoned but not unreasonably so , we stand before the bathroom mirror , marvelling at the crisp clean surfaces of ourselves and one another .
He took a step towards her , then another , until he stood before her , face to face .
Simon had disappeared into the crowd still milling about the hall , and fitzAlan was standing before her .
She stands before me solid as a rivet .
Mr Evans stood behind the counter and read the letter and Albert and Carrie watched him .
I stood behind her and , when she said the word , helped her to heave the load from the ground .
He turned and Paula was standing behind him .
Laura was standing a little behind me , smiling as the wind tousled her hair .
He lifted out a white silk blouse trimmed with fine lace , felt the fabric and handed it to the sales assistant who stood behind them .
Stella was standing beside Alexis .
There he was , standing beside the bed in grey trousers and a black jersey , and looking disgustingly wide-awake .
Lawton loomed up and stood beside him .
Emily was standing beside the stationary Lagonda , holding a bicycle .
Mr Allen was tactless enough to offer his opinion while standing beside Mr Dinkins .
One of those people who stood beside you and waved one of those big carpet-beater things .
Nick looked across the room to where a fat man in jeans stood by the bar and ticked the side of his forehead like a taxi driver acknowledging a tip .
She stood by the glittering bottles and looked at him expectantly .
` It 's Peach , " whispered Leonore , standing by the door .
For the second show their Captain stood by the pianist and rapped out the rhythm .
I stood by the railings and looked across the remains of the grass to where the dyke used to be .
He stood by one of the huge wooden spoked wheels of the hay wagon and looked around .
Connon stood in the door .
She stood in the kitchen doorway .
Something inside her knew it was ridiculous , but she stood in the middle of the room , staring at each hand helplessly , unable to decide .
They stood in the middle of the road as we approached cautiously .
A man was standing in the shadow behind the front door .
They were standing on the paved area behind the house : all the windows were dark , the garden chairs and the round table abandoned and vulnerable .
` And how many humans could even stand on a ball , let along run slowly on it ? " demanded Gurder .
Flames seethed along each crack in its wall , and for Ruth , standing on the circular floor , it was like being in the middle of a fire -- an icy , silent fire .
The Europeans all stand on the station veranda , while an African crowd stands outside the station beside the tracks .
She hurried to the front door , glaring at the man who stood on the step .
He climbed on one side of the desks , stood on tiptoe , and , forcing up the skylight , eased his head through into the icy December wind .
The Doctor stood outside the command vehicle under heavy guard .
Luke stood outside his own front door and read the note that Susan had left under the door-knocker , telling him that she was staying at the Palings Hotel .
If a would-be burglar was standing outside your front or rear door , how many neighbours could see him ?
She watched him as she stood outside Faye 's hospital room , and thought what a thoroughly manly man he was too .
The man , in his early 30s , was wounded in the stomach after two gunmen opened fire as he stood outside his Hazelfield Street home yesterday afternoon .
Oh , I stood outside the primary school this morning and spoke to the other mothers , and none of them want anything to do with it .
Susan stood under an awning and read the extra .
They stood under a cedar tree .
I stood under trees , surveying the stone walls and vines of the Villa Diodati .
He was the kind of man that fat men like to stand next to .
We were standing around him in a ragged semi-circle in the gym at the end of our physical education period .
He climbed out of Armstrong on my side and stood over me until I pushed down my window .
The big dog was so excited he could hardly stand still .
Although the man was old , he stood straight and tall .
She watched Burun dismount , and when he turned to face her they stood wordlessly .
At that precise moment , just over a hundred miles away , Mavis Evers stood barefoot on Bournemouth beach and contemplated suicide .
